title: Rockets' Howard says he played with torn MCL
text:
Rockets' Howard says he played with torn MCL Center says doctors told him he didn't need offseason surgery By The Sports Xchange Tweet Ronald Martinez/Getty Images Houston Rockets center Dwight Howard said he played with a torn MCL and meniscus in last season's playoffs. Related Content Astros take ALDS opener 5-2 against... 
Howard, appearing Thursday on the Houston Texans pregame show on SportsRadio 610, said he played through the injuries during the five-game series loss in the Western Conference finals to the eventual NBA champion Golden State Warriors. 
Howard hurt the knee in the first quarter of Game 1 of the series and was questionable for Game 2 with what was then called a sprained knee. In the second game, he played 40 minutes, finishing with 19 points and 17 rebounds. He played in the remaining three games of the conference finals, averaging 14.4 points and 14.4 rebounds for the series. 
According to an ESPN source, team doctors said he did not need offseason surgery because the tears weren't that severe. 
Howard was out for half of the 2014-15 season due to several injuries, missing two months from January to March following knee surgery. 
Howard, 29, was attending the Texans-Indianapolis Colts game on Thursday night at NRG Stadium. He gave a pregame speech and ran out of the tunnel. Distributed by LAKANA and The Sports Xchange. This material may not be published, broadcast, rewritten or redistributed. Recommended
